portabout.para: NetBSD/luna68k is a port of NetBSD to the LUNA product line of OMRON Tateishi Electric, Japan. The LUNA was a 20MHz/m68030 desktop computer at the age of then-booming UNIX workstations, roughly comparable to a sun3/60 and any m68020/m68030 unix boxes at that time. It is a descendent of the company's 6U VME deskside m68010 box nicknamed Supermate, and was succeeded by a m68040 variant, LUNA-II. It has a rare cousin LUNA-88K which sports 4 88k processors geared by CMU Mach2.5.

portinfo.portml: NetBSD's port to 68k based OMRON LUNA machines
all of the m68k-based NetBSD ports

portnews.portnewsitem: NetBSD 3.1, the first maintenance release of the netbsd-3 release branch, has been released with binary distributions for 53 architectures. More information is available in the 3.1 release announcement.

portnewsitem.title: binary packages for m68k available
portnewsitem.simpara: About 1000 packages built from the latest branch pkgsrc-2006Q1 by &a.oster; are now available at . The packages can be used on all ports based on m68k.
For some more details, see &a.oster;'s announcement

portnews.portnewsitem: NetBSD 3.0 has been released with support for 57 architectures. More information is available in the 3.0 release announcement.

NetBSD 2.1, the first maintenance release of the netbsd-2 release branch, has been released with binary distributions for 48 architectures. More information is available in the 2.1 release announcement.

portsection.title: Supported System Models
portsection.para: NetBSD/luna68k runs on the original LUNA, and supports the following devices:

itemizedlist.listitem: network interface: AMD LANCE with AUI or BNC port (switch-selectable)
SCSI devices; (including built-in TEAC cassette tape drive)
LCD on front panel; (/dev/lcd is under development)

portsection.title: Unsupported Models Devices
portsection.para: NetBSD/luna68k doesn't yet support the following devices:
LUNA-II support is coming soon. Support for the deskside predecessors is not planned at this moment.
